Fries: Oh my God these fries. Beer-battered fries. They are amazing. They are  crispy, delicious, and only $1 an order with the wing or burger deal. If you ever go, please try the fries. They are hands down the best fries I've ever had. 

Service: I have yet to have any rude service here. The waitresses we've encountered have all been very nice and friendly. I actually went today, and missed the name of our waitress, but she was the sweetest lady. She was in her mid to late 20s, I think.  I really wish I caught her name because it was the best service I've had there yet.

Wow. In one visit, you guys go down the shitter.

NEWSFLASH: The fucking smoking ban has NOT been lifted yet. This means, when I come in, and find you propping your door to the bar open, and the restaurant reeks of smoke... and I ask you (yes you, new shithead cook) why the door is propped open, and point out that it's illegal to do so at this point in time, do NOT sit there arguing with me then get snotty and go "Well do you want your drinks or not?"

Sadly, you've lost our business. There are bigger and better places around, and you need to realize where your money comes from. We won't be coming back.

My boyfriend & I decided to go grab a bite to eat before heading out for the night. We saw on Yelp that this place was a good place for burgers so we stopped in.

It's a small little place connected to the Rum Runner (a bar), so we grabbed a seat & chose what toppings we wanted on our burgers & apps we wanted to start with. The little family that runs this place seemed frantic & out of it. The waitress that came over to take our order was a bit negative about her night but seemed nice or like she just had a run in with a bad customer. (Those are the worst, I know because I'm a server too).. 

I ordered a burger med well with the normal toppings (which she forgot some of them) & an iced tea. The tea tasted bad so I drank my water instead. I ordered the cheese curds which were good, but they were just smaller versions of mozzarella sticks. 

All in all, the burgers were a good price, tasted delicious but I feel like the family that runs that place should be a bit more professional & may need a lesson in being a bit more happy & not tell other customers about how shitty their night was!

I was told the wings are amazing, but I don't agree.  I prefer my wings dry, like at T-Bird or Tap House, where they either use a dry rub for spice, or they will spin them in wet sauce and put them back on the grill to roast and dry out, so the skin is crispy and spicy.  The wing meat and skin here was average, and the sauce was wet, which is some people's bag, but not mine.  Cool krab cocktail though!  ;-D
So simple but great food. Hash browns were cooked to perfection. Fast service and nostalgic atmosphere
Stopped in and tried the burger & fries... It was Really good, not the best ever but solid. Menu has plenty of options and very reasonably priced. Ill be back!

Update: I stopped in, hungover as all hell, on my way to the airport. 

Other than the Build-you-own-burger going up in price ($3.99 now), everything was the same. 

There was the same super-friendly service, the same delicious spicy bloody marys from the bar, and the same juicy burgers and fiery hotwings. I brought my grandmother for her first time, and she was impressed. That's a good sign.

Dear Badger Cafe, please open a new location in Nashville. Love, Heather
Server was extremely friendly food portions were great and very generous  something that stood out was the hospitality of the workers and the cleanliness of the establishment

I come here for one reason. It's the chicken wings. They are ginormous and cheap. They're perfectly fried to a well done even the cartilage is crispy too. The cartilage is one of the best parts. Don't knock it until you try it! Try them with any sauce; all good.

Best wings in Vegas by a mile. Where else can you find hot, juicy, crispy and cheap wings? The $3.99 burger and other food items are good too but the wings are the main attraction for me.

Badger Cafe has won my heart.

My fiancé and I were looking for a simple cafe to grab a burger tonight - nothing fancy or pretentious.  We got exactly what we were looking for at Badger Cafe.

The made-to-order burgers are fan-freaking-tastic.  I don't really care for burgers all that much, and I'm rarely in a burger mood.  However, I love the burgers at Badger Cafe.  I was surprised at how un-greasy mine was - it tasted really fresh, and the bun was delicious and flaky.  The grilled onions were amazing.... reminded me of eating White Castle during my adolescence (I'm from Missouri).

We also got an order of the wings.  They are on the small side, but I really like that - sometimes the big wings are gristly and tough.  The skin was flaky and amazing.  I would come back just for the wings sometime, but next time I'll get a hotter sauce.  The medium isn't hot at all.

Best of all, the service was friendly.  It was the kind of place "where everybody knows your name" (*cue Cheers theme song*).  My fiancé and I spent a good chunk of time reminiscing about our first date, which was in a diner not too different from the Badger Cafe (awwwww).  The place just felt home-y like that.  

Highly recommended.  It kinda looks like a dive, but give it a try.

**EDIT:  Holy mother of hot wings.  Their wings are crazy good.  They're small and crispy, but the sauces are delicious.  We always get a mix of BBQ and their hottest hot wings (which are the perfect level of heat - doesn't burn your face off, but stings a little bit).  They are even better than the burgers... if that's even possible... my mind is sufficiently blown.

We found this place on Yelp and had no idea what to expect. It was dark from the outside and the windows had all these large stickers all over it so it didn't give a good impression at first. However, all feelings of reservation were gone after we were warmly greeted by Ashlee and received our appetizers. We had their delicious fried zucchini, which we highly recommend. The rest of our food came out and it was also delicious and great in quality, value, and proportion. Ashlee went so far as to find us crayons for my kids and check on us several times. Exceptional service. We would come again!

The Pros: The food was pretty good. I had eggs on a roll. The cook was very nice and personable.
The Cons: The tall black woman server. She was the worst!!! She would get negative stars if I could. I sat down about 5 minutes before she even came out. The cook let me order straight to him and started my order before I saw her. She came out and asked what I wanted to drink, told her milk. Those were the last words she spoke to me. The milk was bad, I told her, not a word said to me, just brought a new one. Put my food down in front of me, again, nothing said, do you need anything else? Nothing... Finished eating, she put the bill down, again, nothing said, do you want anything else?  So, I hope she got the message when I left her a $.45 tip. That was the change from the order. Oh, I forgot to mention, I was the ONLY one in there...
If you hate your job, go get a new one!!!

So...For decent food that is inexpensive, go here, but if you want decent or better service, go elsewhere...This server was one of the worst I have ever experienced, and I eat out a lot and travel all over...

The food is good but the service was terrible.
It was not busy but only one waitress working. She was doing a great job. Taking care of the 8 customers in the cafe and orders in the bar.
Just not us. It was like we were invisible. Passed by our table twice. The cook came and asked of we have been helped. Got us our drinks and said the waitress would be with us.
15 minutes later she asked if we needed drinks from about 30 feet away. We told her we had them and would like to order. She replied"she would be right there". 5 minutes later we order. 
She was talking and laughing with everyone there and even a take out order.
Maybe we were in her blind spot?
Terrible service.

Decent 1/2 lb build-your-own burger for under $6.  If you are east of the strip or a UNLV student and have a late night hankering for cheap bar food, then this place is for you.   My preference is to order the food to go and chow down in the comfort of your own home.  After all, this is a no frills kind of place.
Go for the wings! Service will never leave you disappointed, and the prices are pretty good. Hole in the wall vibes, but perfect for late nights and cheap eats.

I love this please for the burgers it's amazing but everything on the menu is tasty service is ok to good if they are jam on a football night they are usually under staff but they're friendly 

Its all about the prices here this food should be priced higher but it's same worth the money here

Best burger in Vegas hands down! Badger Cafe is connected to the Rum Runner, so you can eat in the bar and get 24 oz. beers for only $4.50 

You build your own 1/2 pound burger for $3.99 and it is AWESOME!! I would highly suggest getting their wings. They are just as good as the burger. They have around 12 different sauces and a flavor of the month. 

The staff here is great and you will want to go back. They make you feel like they have known you for years.

$3.99 is the starting price. Lettuce, onions, pickles, grilled onions, and mayo are free options. For $.30 each, you can get double cheddar, double swiss, ranch, or tomatoes. $.60 gets you guacamole or grilled mushrooms. And $.75 gets bacon, a fried egg, or fries. When it is all said and done, a monster burger can be had for less than $10. 

Although it lists an option for how you want your burger cooked, my medium rare came out medium well. The one waitress and one cook was pumping out food as fast as they could so I just sucked it up. Overall, the burger was good. The diner smelt of grease, but the food was not drenching in oil like other places. The mushrooms came out flavorful, but not covered in oil. I appreciated that. The cheese curds ($4.99) was my favorite item. Can never go wrong with fried cheese. There is a $1 to go box fee if you do not order a drink.

I've been going here for years and went I went recently with my family, the cook was very very rude. My order was messed up and he wouldn't stop yelling about it as if it were my fault ! This was absolutely embarrassing and insulting . I know it's a small diner and all , but seriously who treats a guest like that ?! The server was nice though and the food ended up being really good . I would try their build your own burgers

Even though they've raised their price a buck...at $4.99 Badgers build your own burger is still a tasty bargain. My son and I had the burger..wife had a BLT. all gave it high grades. feel as though we got a flavor of the real las Vegas...not some cookie cutter chain deal. There are some "sketchy" characters patronizing this spot...but overall its a solid thumbs up. Service was fine...food was good...and the price is right!

We went to the badger Café for the Fish n Chips on a Friday night the beer was cold from the bar the fish n chip were cook perfect.  The service was as cold as the beer....  Really crappy service....  

We will try again in a few weeks!

So I stumbled upon this little gem after yelp surfing on my phone and boy I wasn't disappointed.

I met my boyfriend here for some bar food without the smoke. Sometimes smoke alone can ruin the experience. The rum runner bar was hopping but we were the only sit down people at the cafe based on yelp reviews we weren't worried. The waitress was super friendly and chatty with us while we decided what to order. We filled out the cards specially laid out for the wings and burgers.
He ordered 12 wings two different styles hot and bbq hot and french fries.
I had the burger mid well, tomato, double cheese and 1000 island on the side. 
Our food arrived *check out my pic called omg lets eat!*, and we were in heaven. My burger was cooked just right, bun was toasted, juicy but not overly juicy to where it made the bun wet and nasty, cheese was melted to perfection. His wings were plump and juicy not one small one in the batch. Fries were hot and crunchy. Two sides of ranch, carrots and celery without having to ask or being charged extra? Love it!! Take notes Bdubs!  

For two our bill came to 15.80 + 4.00 cash for tip.
And we were full and satisfied with the service we received and the food was great! We will be back to try some different things on the menu! 
Why is my mouth watering writing this review!!!!?!!!?!?!?! :-)

If your in the area try this place out! A bargain for a great meal and friendly staff!

Wow. Don't know who took over, but this place went downhill FAST. Went here about a month ago. Did the build-your-own burger as I normally do. I ordered it well done, as usual. I had to send it back TWICE because they gave it to me raw. Afterwards, I said fuck it, and just went home. This time, the tomato's and lettuce tasted like chemicals. Yuck. Screw this place.

Excellent greasy spoon diner, don't be afraid to come in, the food here is excellent and very cheap. After two days of eating on the strip we were sick of overpriced mediocre burgers. Badger cafe is attached to a neighborhood bar, Rum Runner, and was 15 minutes off the strip in suburbia. I had a chopped salad with chicken, it was simple and fresh and very tasty. My co conspirator had great pancakes, eggs and bacon at 11pm at night. Definitely worth the trip for good comfort food.

Recently discovered this hidden gem and now it turns out to be one of the favorite spots for me and my buddies to hang out, after playing some pool at the rum runner bar, with a couple beers and some chicken wings we always finish off with a killa burger custom made, i like mine with a friend egg,ortega chili, bacon, American cheese, grilled onions and 1000 island can't beat that and can't beat that price either. Best thing is its open 24/7, can't get a better burger than that after hours.

I really wanna give this place 5 stars, but can't...It's a Golden gem with some of the city's best bar food.. 

Not worth 5 stars cuz: It's smokey from the connected bar. If you're not a smoker, it's the grossest thing in public. Should be against the law to smoke in public. The portions are inconsistent. I usually order the breakfast skillet. Whether 2am, or 12noon, sometimes it fills the skillet with a heap of yummy goodness and sometimes it's LITERALLY half the amount. No, not a smaller "lunch" portion. Just inconsistent portions. Plus small extra things are "just" soso, like their toast. 

Why it's worth 5 stars: Beer-battered brat bites! So frigen good. I get one or two orders every time I visit. Love em. The waitresses are usually pretty damn nice and friendly. Even if they are being fake, I don't care. They're not my friends, haha. The breakfast skillet is one of the tastiest in town, and a great deal for 8 bucks (when you get the normal full portion). Very large menu, with great prices.

My partner read about this place on Yelp and we decided to go there last Sunday after church. My original thought from outside was "Wow, what a dive." We went into the wrong door and sat in the Rumrunner. It was stale  and smoky and I wasn't going to stay. It was then that I looked over and saw the cafe. We originally thought it was a different place until we saw that the menu was for Badger Cafe. My, am I glad we stayed. I love the idea of building your own burger. Immediately, I was impressed with that and the fact that prices were so reasonable. Michelle (I believe) was very helpful and friendly. We received our meals quickly. The burger was delicious. The fries were good also. I didn't really like the iced tea, but who cares about that. I was there for the burger and was not disappointed. I love supporting local businesses and I will definitely go back when I want a great burger.

My wife brought me here for my birthday and meet some friends to play pool next door.  I grew up in Wisconsin, so I am always a little leery of places that claim to have Wisconsin cuisine.  The food was very good and did remind of something I would get at greasy spoon back home, and decor certainly reminded me of WI.  It's very small and a little divey, it was clean, just a little worn.  The service is a little off.  There were a few times my wife sent me to the counter to order things, as the server had not been seen for a while.  It wasn't a bad experience, but we haven't been back either.

Went last night with the family as we discovered this place isn't barely a block away from home. We enjoyed ourselves. 

Husband ordered a "Build Your Own Burger" and from what I saw it was a good burger. He inhaled it along with their fries. 

My son ordered wings and fries from the kids menu. And he enjoyed it too. The fries were abundant and he actually was too stuffed to finished them. 

I ordered the blackened wings with bleu cheese and fries. I left the bone completely clean. They were spicy enough for my experienced palate to take a step back to appreciate the spice. Blackened to perfection. And my fries were great too. 

Next time I'll order the same wings but I def want to give the chips (made fresh to order) a try.

The place doesn't look like much, but it deserves a 5star rating. It's clean, the service was great, it was cheap, and the food was good. 
My boyfriend had the chicken fried steak breakfast style (with hashbrowns, toast, and eggs rather than with mashed potatoes and I forget what else) and we ordered  some wings just to try 'em. An order of beer battered fries along with it for just 75cents more-- heaven! The wings were juicy and delish, and his plate was scrumptious and artery clogging.  I had a simple salad (hey, I was trying to cancel out the fries), and it actually turned out to be pretty tasty too. 
Even after making the boyfriend eat a couple bites of salad he insisted on mopping up his leftover yolk and gravy with some toast wedges. 
It was that good.

Oh Badger Cafe, how far you have fallen. Many days and nights, my broke college-going self would make my way through your doors, the juicy, hand-pressed burgers were right in my budget and oh-so delicious!

The last few times we have gone in for burgers, there were problems. Not serious enough to write you off, we would wait a little while, then head back and try again. Problems again. 

What kind of problems you ask?
- The past FIVE times, my wife has ordered grilled mushrooms on her burger. The past FIVE times, she has received ZERO mushrooms on her burger.
- Every third time or so, your food works like McDonald's and Burger King - a la a guaranteed intestinal cleanse. Not pleasant at all.
- The size of the mayo/thousand island cups has shrunk to where a french fry folded in half is as wide as the mouth of the cup. Seriously?!
- Finally, despite re-assurances from the staff, there is no way in hell those are hand-pressed burgers. So dry, tough and flavorless, That is the signature of pre-made patties.*

If the burger maintained its hand-pressed tastiness, we could get over the other items, or at least, feel up for the gamble of if we had to race home and to the bathroom. No sense in continuing to support food that declined so much.

Also, having staff engaging in lengthy discussions about how much they hate other staff members that aren't there, with each other - and regular customers, is very unprofessional. If you have an issue with that person, talk to them, deal with it, shut up or quit. I don't want to feel involved in your drama, because that is the only thing that could be heard in the restaurant.



* I used to flip burgers and hand press 40-50 lbs of burgers a couple times a week, I have some experience in this area.

Visited on Saturday September 3, 2016 around 9AM.  This restaurant is located on Tropicana at Spencer.  It's in the same shopping center as Gorilla Sushi and attached to Rum Runner.  I wasn't so sure if kids were allowed but they said it was alright to bring our toddler in. There is a sign on the door that says after 10 pm minors must be accompanied by an adult.  

Anyhoo....this greasy spoon may be one of the last divey mom n' pop places left in Vegas.  The place is dated in a cool, retro way and still has barstools and a cool round spinny-ticket-holder-thingy in the kitchen.  Our server was a mother and a veteran and just as friendly as they come.  

The food is cheap as hell and all three of us ate here for like $17 bucks.  They seem to specialize in breakfast and "drunk foods" like chicken wings and burgers.  

For $5.59 I got the "pan-san" which came with eggs any way you want, pancakes, and bacon.  I would have paid much, much more for this.  The pancakes were huge and fluffy and perfectly cooked.  The bacon was so thick but still crispy and the eggs were perfectly scrambled and buttery.  It was the *perfect* breakfast.  

My husband said his breakfast burrito was good but the tortilla was really hard in some places.  He just tore off the bad spots and said he enjoyed the rest.  The biscuits and gravy were not the best I've ever had but were adequate and clearly homemade.  The biscuits tasted a lot like uncooked flour so maybe they were a bit undercooked but they were hard so I think maybe they were just not the freshest.  

I can imagine if you were at the bar next door this place would be like manna from heaven as far as drunk food goes.  But for normal (sober) folks like me this is just A-OKAY.

This place hits the value/quality/quantity mark on the nose. They have daily specials, I had the pot roast dinner for $7 included a salad, mashed potatoes, green beans, garlic bread, and a nice sized portion of moist and tasty pot roast. That, my friends, is a bargain!

The salad came in a bowl and included plenty of tomatoes, cheese, cucumbers along with lettuce. I've had worse salads at more expensive places. The gravy wasn't over salted, which I find in a lot of places. 

They are located next to Rum Runner bar on Tropicana and Spencer. Many of the bar patrons ordered food and from what I could see it all looked good. You can byob (build your own burger). The nightly specials are what stood out to me, I can see myself eating Lasagna on Tuesdays, and Garlic Parmesian Chicken on Sundays a lot!

Seems to be plenty of parking, so no worries here.

Came here for a quick bite before dropping friend at the airport and making my drive home to phoenix. We kept driving away from the strip because we didn't want to spend too much money but we also didn't want fast food, so we ended here. 

First glances from outside, I questioned our decision but actually it's quite cute and diner style inside. Our waitress was very nice but seemed to be the only one working, which not many tables in the diner but I think the bar on the other side was her job as well. 

They have really great prices and lots to choose from of diner style food. One friend got the BLT with fries (she liked hers, fries were awesome), another the nachos (they looked okay....), and myself the quesadilla. The reason I'm rating this place a 3 and not a 4 and it's very in between those marks was because of a few issues. One, I was freezing, they have the fans blowing at high speed, poor little couple that were there had to move to this tiny table that seemed the only spot where it wasn't as cold. Two, she wrote down the order and even repeated almost everything that were on the dishes back to us... My friend who got nachos was missing the jalapeños, and I order the quesadilla no tomatoes and repeated it twice.... I got tomatoes and my food came out 5 minutes after my friends. I was too hungry to say anything and on a time crunch to ask to have it fixed. Also the quesadilla was suppose to have Ortega chilies, pretty sure it got the jalapeños that were suppose to be on the nachos. On the plus side, the quesadilla was really good, and the tomatoes were very minimal it didn't ruin the flavor for me. Not sure where the error was and I understand it happens, so that's why I'm not rating any lower. 

It's actually a cute spot, I just might have gotten an off day.

This is a quaint, tiny cafe connected to a micro casino with a bar. They are open 24 hours a day and they have an extensive menu for a small diner and apparently they serve everything all day and all night. 

The prices are really cheap and the food is your basic diner type dishes, let's just say it's similar to Denny's food but half the price and certainly tastes better.

They have a huge empty parking lot if you're a trucker.

I swear this was the second best meal I had in Vegas, first was Gordon Ramsey Steak...seriously good food, fresh and good portions.  My husband was so bummed we found this plaace the day before flew home.  He said the wings were the best he's ever had.  Very generous kid meal portions and the 3.99 build a burger is so worth it.  Check this place out!

Its taken me a while but I finally got back to the Badger Cafe during dinner hours.  I was fairly impressed with both my burger and the wings. 

The burger was thick and juicy I ordered it medium and it was a little medium rare but otherwise perfect. The toppings were a thick slice of tomato a nice layer of lettuce and some grilled onions. A vadallia onion would have been perfect  but oh so good as it was. I didnt like that the guacamole and Mayo were in plastic containers as the mayo looked old and past its prime but still glad it was there and not on the burger as it may have ruined the Burger.

The wings were perfectly fried. Crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The sauce was the hottest they had and my tastebuds could hardly tell. I didnt blow my nose till the end of the meal. A better sauce would put these wings at the top of my list for wings in Vegas.

The menu at Badger is simple and basic, the way bar food should be. And the prices are cheap to! So add those two combined with a build your own burger and you have a recipe for success in my book. My friends and I regularly visit this fine establishment a few times a month and the food nor the service has failed us yet. 

Extra points for the dive bar atmosphere!

These guys have no class and no respect. I ordered well before 7 other customers, and each of them got their food before me. This place sucks royally. Please boycott this place until they learn some tact.

I am a fan. There hasn't ever been a time when I have had company come in town to visit and I didn't take them to this place.

Seriously, you cannot go wrong with the burgers, wings, fries and onion rings in this place.

The burgers are all made to order and you simply check on your Menu Sheet what you want on your burger and how you want it cooked. Same goes with the wings, how many wings, what flavors, what sides, etc. 

It's the best cheap eats around. Seriously. 

Sometimes the service can be a little slow especially when the bar next door is extremely busy so do not come here in a rush. Lay back and enjoy the moment and cheap food you are about to experience. If you take your burger to go, please note that they charge you a dollar extra.

This little restaurant is situated next to the billiard bar and it looks like it's pretty famous among the locals. We ordered fried shrimp and mushroom. And everything tastes really good. My bf said their diet soda was the best in town. The lady who works their was super friendly and helped us to order. In my opinion, the prices are a little bit high for a place off the strip.

Well, this was my second visit, and unfortunately will be my last visit. My first visit was fine, and what brought me back was, Built your Burger. You fill out a menu card with what you want want on your Burger and how you want your Angus meat cooked, I did, with my burger to be Medium Rare. 
Burger arrived in timely manner, Only one other customer, besides me. One bite into the burger and I had to remove the Dry over cooked meat from my mouth. Now I'm seating at the counter, stone throw from the cook and the young waitress, I pushed the plate away from me with the meat exposed along with the hamburger. Mintues go by and I ask the waitress for my check, as she started to walk away to get check I said that the Burger was terrible, and showed her the over cooked meat. Did not offer to replace or offer not to pay for it. She brings the check, she runs my CC, I payed and started to get up from my chair and then and only then did they offer me another burger to go. I declined because of the quality of the burger and the way it was cooked.
If your looking for a decent burger, this is definitely not the place. I would go to Burger King before I would ever return to this joint.

I like this place open 24/7 the lady manager or owner idk what she is was very friendly, they are nice here, they gave me double ranch with out charge. I got the sampler appetizer.  I like the fried zucchini the best I subsituted the jalapeno poppers for mushrooms, they didn't charge me extra 4 that either. Maybe I should have tried the poppers cause now I'm curious going to come back to try the burger next time. Food tasted better when there is a friendly server I think. I took togo. Would be nice if they served pizza here. :)
